TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in FAC . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by their Agent , PERSON , succeeded by PERSON P. ORG in that function .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In a judgment delivered on CARDINAL DATE the Bratislava CARDINAL ORG dissolved the marriage of the applicant and his wife . The court took note of the former spouses’ agreement under which their CARDINAL children would be placed in the mother ’s custody and that the applicant had undertaken to contribute to their maintenance .

On DATE the applicant claimed before the Bratislava CARDINAL ORG that he had not fathered CARDINAL children to whom his former wife had given birth in DATE and in DATE respectively . He argued that he had neither lived with his former wife nor had he had sexual intercourse with her at the relevant time . He gave the particulars of a person with whom his former wife had lived since DATE and whom he considered to be the natural father of the children .
In her observations the applicant ’s former wife proposed that the claim be dismissed . She admitted , however , that the applicant was not the natural father of CARDINAL of the children .

ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim on DATE . It found that the applicant had failed to submit it within DATE after he had learned about the children ’s birth as required by Section ORG ) of LAW . The judgment stated that the applicant could request ORG to file an action with a view to having his paternity disproved pursuant to ORG ) of LAW .

The applicant filed such a request on DATE . He alleged that another person with whom his former wife had lived at the relevant time had admitted that he had fathered the CARDINAL children . The applicant explained that he had failed to respect the time - limit laid down in Section ORG ) of LAW as , at the relevant time , he had not been informed about that provision and that he had been in a difficult material and psychological situation .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request . The letter stated that it had not been reliably shown that the applicant was not the natural father of the children . Such proof could only be obtained by a blood test . However , the applicant ’s former wife was opposed to such a test , and public prosecutors had no power to order that she and the children should undergo it . The letter concluded that , in view of the above and given the lack of general interest in having the issue determined , there was no reason for proceeding pursuant to LAW ) of LAW .

On DATE the applicant challenged ORG conclusion before ORG . He pointed out that his former wife had explicitly admitted that the applicant might not have fathered CARDINAL of the children and argued that it was in the general interest to have the issue determined .

On DATE a public prosecutor of ORG informed the applicant that his former wife was still opposed to a blood test , and that it was therefore not possible to obtain reliable proof indicating that the applicant was not the natural father of the children . The public prosecutor concluded that no further action could be taken on the applicant ’s request .
On DATE the applicant asked ORG to order an expert opinion in the context of which the hair and nails of the persons concerned should be analysed and their physiognomy compared .

On DATE ORG replied to the applicant that he was free to obtain such an expert opinion of his own initiative . The applicant was further informed that he could file a new request for proceedings to be brought pursuant to LAW ) of LAW in the event that he obtained reliable proof that he was not the natural father of the children .
On DATE the applicant claimed that the maintenance which he had to pay in respect of the children born to his former wife be reduced .
On DATE the Bratislava CARDINAL ORG transferred the case to the GPE CARDINAL ORG for reasons of jurisdiction .
On DATE the Bratislava CARDINAL ORG heard the parties . On DATE the case was adjourned . As the applicant ’s former wife was detained on remand , ORG again adjourned the case on DATE .
On DATE the Bratislava CARDINAL ORG dismissed the action .

On DATE the applicant appealed . Subsequently the applicant ’s former wife filed a counter - claim , on behalf of the children , with a view to having the maintenance payable by the applicant increased . ORG submitted the claim to the applicant for comments , apparently in the context of the same proceedings .
On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision to dismiss the applicant ’s claim .

A hearing concerning the applicant ’s former wife ’s claim for the maintenance to be increased was held before the Bratislava CARDINAL ORG on DATE . The applicant informed the court that he could not appear for financial reasons . The Bratislava CARDINAL ORG therefore asked ORG to hear the applicant . The latter court returned the file to ORG on DATE .
On DATE the Bratislava CARDINAL ORG increased the maintenance due by the applicant . The applicant appealed .
ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on DATE .
Pursuant to Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , the husband of a woman who gives birth to a child during the marriage or not DATE after its dissolution shall be considered the child ’s father .
Section ORG ) provides that a husband can deny paternity before a court within DATE after learning that his wife gave birth to a child .

Under LAW ) , when the time - limit for denying paternity has expired , ORG may file an action to disprove paternity provided that the determination of the issue is justified by the interests of society .
According to the practice of the public prosecutors , an action under LAW ) of LAW can only be filed when reliable proofs exist that the mother ’s husband did not father the child .
